intro: Chaenactis evermannii, commonly known as the Evermann's paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
